## Questions {-}

### 1 {-}

Find the scalar product of $\vec{u}$ and $\vec{v}$.

1.1. $\vec{u} = \begin{pmatrix}6\\3\\4\end{pmatrix}$ and $\vec{v} = \begin{pmatrix}1\\-4\\2\end{pmatrix}$

1.2. $\vec{u} = \begin{pmatrix}10\\-7\\4\end{pmatrix}$ and $\vec{v} = \begin{pmatrix}3\\-5\\13\end{pmatrix}$

1.3. $\vec{u}=2\mathbf{i}-\mathbf{k}$ and $\vec{v}=6\mathbf{i}-4\mathbf{j}+8\mathbf{k}$

1.4. $\vec{u}= -\mathbf{j}+7\mathbf{k}$ and $\vec{v}=\mathbf2{i}+10\mathbf{k}$

### 2 {-}

Find the value(s) of $\lambda$ for which $\vec{u}$ and $\vec{v}$ are perpendicular

2.1. $\vec{u} = \begin{pmatrix}2\\4\\6\end{pmatrix}$ and $\vec{v} = \begin{pmatrix}1\\\lambda\\2\end{pmatrix}$

2.2. $\vec{u} = \begin{pmatrix}0\\1\\\lambda\end{pmatrix}$ and $\vec{v} = \begin{pmatrix}1\\2\\3\end{pmatrix}$

2.3. $\vec{u} = \begin{pmatrix}9\\-2\\5\end{pmatrix}$ and $\vec{v} = \begin{pmatrix}\lambda\\-\lambda\\6\end{pmatrix}$ 

2.4. $\vec{u} = \begin{pmatrix}\lambda\\7\\1\end{pmatrix}$ and $\vec{v} = \begin{pmatrix}\lambda\\\lambda\\5\end{pmatrix}$ 

### 3 {-}

Let $\vec{x} = \begin{pmatrix}\lambda\\\mu\\1\end{pmatrix}$. Find $\lambda$ and $\mu$ such that $\vec{x}$ is perpendicular to both $\vec{u}$ and $\vec{v}$.

3.1. $\vec{u} = \begin{pmatrix}1\\1\\-3\end{pmatrix}$ and $\vec{v} = \begin{pmatrix}5\\-2\\-1\end{pmatrix}$

3.2. $\vec{u} = \begin{pmatrix}2\\3\\-3\end{pmatrix}$ and $\vec{v} = \begin{pmatrix}1\\-6\\2\end{pmatrix}$
